value: Title Page, "Suite de douze Pêcheurs et Chasseurs"

label: Description
value: Decorative landscape with man riding an ostrich and felling a duck. Two bordering lines. Top, right corner: "1". Bottom: "J. Pillement.del."; "j. j. avril-sculp.1771." Bottom center: "Suite de douze Pêcheurs et Chasseurs / se vend à Paris chés Basan et Poignant Mds d'Estampes, rue et Hôtel / Serpente."

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

Plate 8, "Suite de douze Pêcheurs et Chasseurs"

label: Description
value: Decorative landscacpe in which a Chinese figure pursues, with a curved sword, a horned animal resembling a dinosaur. Two framing lines. Right top corner: "8." Right top corner: "7." Bottom: "J. Pillement.del."; "j. j. avril-sculp.1771." Bottom center: "Suite de douze Pêcheurs et Chasseurs / se vend à Paris chés Basan et Poignant Mds d'Estampes, rue et Hôtel / Serpente." Upper left corner, in ink: No. 31".

Design for the Border of a Woven Fabric of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Trophies, of which two are shown, form a horizontal row. They consist of a lute, two winds, an open music book, and flower boughs. Bottom: a row of canopies which are connected by crowns. The vertical motif is shown horizontally.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and white gouche on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for Embroidery of Overskirt, for Fabrique de St. Ruf

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle.  A bunch composed of poppies and other blossoms and ears of grain is shown in the wedge.  Plants of poppies and cornflowers alternate among the hem, small plants grow in the intervals.  A row of beads and a ribbon form the hem.  Reverse:  rough sketch of the bunch of flowers.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

Design for the Lower Front Part of an Overskirt of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Bunches of flowers are connected by a cord, a fringed bead chain, a garland with a peacock feather garland drunning inside along the hem. Ovoidal medallions connected by flower boughs are outside. Written in ink: "p 1610," top right, "po 1610 S. R." and by another hand: "Prior[it]é Cadet Leubros," bottom left.

label: Credit line

Design For the Embroidery of a Man's Waistcoat of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: The left bottom corner is shown. Roses combined with fantastical flowers, and small plants, grow from the border lines. A bunch of flowers at the pocket.

label: Physical description
value: Graphic, brush and white gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1920; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Embroidery of a Man's Waistocst, No. 940 of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: The left bottom corner is shown with an obliquely rising bottom edge. Bunches of flowers, in which roses are included, are connected at left by rose garlands, at the bottom by a zigzag line from which small plants emerge. The last bunch of flowers, at right, is over the zigzag line. Two bunches of flowers and a zigzag line decorate the field of the pocket.

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1920; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Embroidery of a Man's Waistcoat of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: The borders show flower boughs along the insides of a moulding. The top of a forked tree grows into the pocket and the right fork beyond it.

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1920; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Embroidery of the Lower Front Part of an Overskirt of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: A kind of embroidered cloth is shown along the hem. Its fringed upper part is fastened by nails from which rise alternately a fantastical palm plant and a plant with naturalistic flowers. A bunch of flowers which is connected with two palms by garlands is suggested in the wedge. "P. 1534" is written in ink in the upper center"

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Embroidery of a Man's Waistcoat of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Left bottom corner, crenellated bands along the inner edge, beneath and beside the pocket. The fields are decorated with bunches of flowers and shells. The motifs are connected by festoons, bordering cross-hatched grounds. Cord festoons are suspended from the bottom of the pocket. Plants are included in the pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1920; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Embroidery of a Man's Waistcoat, Pattern No. 519 of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: A lady's hat lies on a bunch of flowers, in the center, connected with it by waved boughs and roses. Garland festoons are suspended from the bottom edge motif of the pocket and plants rising from the central motif. A garland is suspended from the top edge of the pocket. One end of it rises into the field.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gouache on paper
